Title: Series: Life of the Virgin
Description: One of the series of 20 woodcuts, without text; in the yard of a ruined house the Holy Family is resting on their flight into Egypt, with St Joseph mending a wooden trough, the Virgin sitting and spinning, the cradle with the sleeping infant Christ next to her, various putti and angels assisting. c.1502 Woodcut
Curator's comments: Watermark: bull's head with triangle and flower (Meder 62). CD: watermark: Ha.19
Bibliographic references: Dodgson 1903, 1911 / Catalogue of Early German and Flemish Woodcuts in the BM, 2 vols (I.289.50a)
Schoch 2001-04 / Albrecht Dürer, das druckgraphische Werk. 3 vols I Intaglio, II Woodcuts, III Book illustrations (II.180)
Acquisition notes: No indication of provenance on the verso. This print, however, belongs to a series (E,3.88 - 105) other impressions of which bear on the verso Sloane's initials in Philipe's hand. It is therefore assumed that the whole series comes from Sloane's collection.
